question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: Stepping Stone Event Center hosted my band once. Great acoustics actually. Support local venues.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I'm a musician wanting to teach lessons. Affordable studio space and help marketing to families.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Creative economy is real economy. Don't forget artists and musicians when planning development.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: A proper sit-down restaurant not fast food. And better grocery options besides Kroger.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: Goodies bakery is wonderful. Such a sweet lady who runs it. Also been to 1996 Eatery.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I'm retired but volunteer with seniors. Transportation to local businesses is a barrier for many elderly.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Don't forget seniors in planning. We have money to spend but need accessibility and convenience.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: A community workspace - like WeWork but affordable. Also more food variety beyond American fare.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: Real Deal Boxing is a community institution. Also get my car detailed by Trotter. Quality services.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I do web development freelance. Local networking opportunities to find clients would be valuable.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Remote workers like me could revitalize daytime economy. Coffee shop plus co-working is the formula.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: Clothing boutique and a better salon.

response_text: Beauty industry could be bigger here. Lots of talent.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: Hardware store definitely. Also a local pub or tavern for gathering. Community spaces matter.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: 1996 Eatery occasionally. Otherwise mostly shop at Kroger and the bakery that's been here forever.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: Just a resident not an entrepreneur. But would frequent any new local business that opens.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Been here 30 years. Seen the decline. Ready to see the comeback. Invest in Hamilton Avenue.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: A tutoring center and after-school programs. Kids need structure and parents need childcare help.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: My kids love Goodies for treats. And 1996 Eatery is our Friday night go-to. Support Black always.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I tutor kids on the side. Want to formalize into a real learning center. Space and startup funding needed.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Invest in youth services and you invest in the future. Kids are economic development too.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: A credit union or community bank. Also tire shop and oil change place. Automotive basics.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: Trotter Mobile Detailing is excellent. Comes to my house and does great work and fair price. That's service.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I've been fixing cars for decades. Thinking about opening a shop but commercial real estate is confusing.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: The trades are being forgotten. Support mechanics and electricians and plumbers. We need skilled workers.

question_text: What types of businesses are missing in North College Hill that you wish were here?
response_text: A real spa! Massages and facials and the works. Self-care matters. Also need a wine bar for girls night.

question_text: Do you currently support any Black-owned businesses in the area? Which ones?
response_text: Twisted Nails religiously. Splitting Wigs for my hair. 1996 Eatery for soul food. Supporting Black women entrepreneurs!

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: I do makeup for events. Want to expand to permanent studio. Financing and location assistance needed.

question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about local businesses and economic development?
response_text: Black women are the economic engine of this community. Support us and watch NCH flourish.

response_text: A VFW or American Legion post. Also more dining options for vets. We're a community too.

question_text: If you're a business owner or aspiring entrepreneur, what support would help you most?
response_text: Retired military. If there were grants for veteran-owned businesses that might interest me.

response_text: Veteran-owned business incentives could bring entrepreneurship to those who served. Think about it.

response_text: Quality childcare center and a swim school for kids. Also a family entertainment center of some kind.

response_text: 1996 Eatery is family favorite. Stepping Stone Event Center for my daughter's birthday. Both excellent.

response_text: Childcare is economic infrastructure. Parents can't work without it. Make it a priority for NCH.
